result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L Gibson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence; STRAIGHT TIME
Court allows probation to be transferred to Kenosha County

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid during term of probation; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at $0.

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment unless in school. If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job; if defendant is in school part-time, defendant to have a full-time job.
- Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
- No Contact with Kohl's Dept. Store, JC Penny, Macys and Boston Store located at Southridge Mall, 5300 S. 76th Street, Milwaukee.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon L Gibson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon L Gibson in court with attorney Matthew E. Weil.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS, straight time, in the House of Corrections, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 1 YEAR with the following conditions:
-Restitution set at $0
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job; if defendant is in school part-time, defendant to have a full-time job 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-No contact with No contact with Kohl's Department Store, JC Penny, Macys and Boston Store located at Southridge Mall, 5300 S. 76th Street, Milwakee
-Court allows probation to be transferred to Kenosha County

FIled, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit form

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to the amended charge and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant Brandon L Gibson in court with atorney Matthew E. Weil.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge be amended to Theft by Fraud, Party to a Crime pursuant to Wisc. Stats 943.20(1)(d), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Original Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Amended Information, waived reading and entered a plea of not guilty.

Defendant Brandon L Gibson in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Calendar call.  Appearance of Attorney Matthew Weil excused by the Court.  Defendant present; stayed bench warrant withdraw at this time.  Defendant provided next court date information selected with his defense counsel on 5-05-15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew E. Weil in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing.  Defendant not present.  Defense motion for stayed warrant granted.  The Court orders Bench Warrant to Issue, but STAYED until 5-06-15, 12pm.  Parties selected adjourned sentencing date in the event the defendant appears.  Calendar call scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Brandon L Gibson in court with attorney Matthew E. Weil.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon L Gibson in court with attorney Matthew E. Weil.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Southridge Mall

Court sets bail at $500.00 cash.  Case passed to allow Defense time to speak with the Defendant regarding bail.   

SAME DAY, SAME APPEARANCES.  Case recalled at the hour of 4:00 pm.  Court amends bail.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandon L Gibson in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Brandon L Gibson in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
